entry.title: [//media] Remove no-op call to UploadVideoFrameToGLTexture()
entry.content:
This call invokes UploadVideoFrameToGLTexture() on pure-software

VideoFrames (the one callsite of CopyVideoFrameYUVDataToGLTexture() is

[1]). UploadVideoFrameToGLTexture() will always return false in this

case [2]. This CL removes the call for clarity.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/webgl/webgl_rendering_context_base.cc;l=6303-6309;drc=c292340f0c721cd88f9b14c453c877c55d13ce6b

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/renderers/paint_canvas_video_renderer.cc;l=1618-1620;drc=c292340f0c721cd88f9b14c453c877c55d13ce6b;bpv=1;bpt=1



Bug: 40057997, 40062791

entry.title: [//media] Remove killswitch for 1c legacy MP VideoFrame->GL via SI
entry.content:
This code has been widely exercised on stable with no issues reported:



* Running on 10% stable for 120+ in first half of January, and vetted

via Meet metrics

* Running on 40% stable for 120+ second half of January, and approved

for launch from POV of Meet

* Running on 99% stable for 120+ since February 1

* Enabled by default in code in 122, which went to stable on

non-ChromeOS on February 20 and on ChromeOS on March 5



This CL rips out the killswitch that allows disabling this codepath. If

there are any issues reported (which seems very unlikely at this point),

we will diagnose and fix-forward.



Change-Id: I319fb2477e8348f99f5e05d56d0288d57ee247c3

Bug: 40062791

entry.title: [//media] Fix fuchsia_video_decoder_unittest's ClientSI creation
entry.content:
These unittests create ClientSharedImage instances that are backed by

GMBs, and thus they need to specify the GMB handle type so that

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() operates correctly.

entry.title: Reduce raciness of BidirectionalStreamTests
entry.content:
BidirectionalStreamTests were triggering tsan errors because the network

thread was still active after the test had completed. Explicitly

shut down the thread at the end of each test. Add a

TestStreamEngine getter class to manage the lifetime of the engine

instead of using global variables.



BUG=40628504

entry.title: Fix ColorSpace issue for DrawVideoFrameIntoResourceProvider()
entry.content:
GPUExternalTexture uses a opt uploading path CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage() to achieve 1-copy path. DrawVideoFrameIntoResourceProvider() was added in CL

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5329940

as a fallback path.



However there are some remain issues:

- The check about using CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage() is not restricted.

- The color space issue in DrawVideoFrameIntoResourceProvider(),

mentioned in crbug.com/1407112 was not workaround.



This CL fixed above issues by correcting checking condition about using

CopyVideoFrameToSharedImage() and working around color space issue for

DrawVideoFrameIntoResourceProvider() path.



Bug: chromium:328028609,chromium:327270287,chromium:40253022

Change-Id: I04a0285bb3290d8ebcd1c6f0e37b3480b270016d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5342429

Reviewed-by: Corentin Wallez

Reviewed-by: Dan Sanders

entry.title: Audio offload for video streaming behind flag.
entry.content:
This enables audio offload behind flag only for streams with latency tag set to kPlayback. For other latency types, audio offload will always be disabled.

Use --enable-features=AudioOffload to enable it. By default the buffer time is 50ms. You can specify buffer time(in ms) by adding extra param for the audio offload feature instead(for example):

--enable-features=AudioOffload:buffer_time_ms/70



Audio offload requires audio service to be at low integrity level, so please make sure audio service is sandboxed when turning on this feature, otherwise the audio output will be automatically switched to non-offload low latency mode.



Bug: chromium:41472482

Change-Id: I7c415274d8378dded76a3c6bb211c84f4c9124f4

entry.title: Revert "[pdf-a11y]: make two tests compatible with --force-renderer-accessibility"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e4669a2e560c9c28d54413cd056ce11dbbe50657.



Reason for revert: May be causing flaky pdf a11y tests: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/46517/overview



Original change's description:

> [pdf-a11y]: make two tests compatible with --force-renderer-accessibility

>

> Passing

> browser_tests ... --force-renderer-accessibility

>

> enables a11y early on and changes the exact flow of the tests in

> question. AXTreeUpdate(s) come earlier and so any logic that waits for

> specific details may not work.

>

> This change ensures that we rewrite this logic to listen for the more

> specific event that is tied to selections.

>

the utils from pending_beacon-helper.js. This CL just moves that

helper onto `fetch/fetch-later/` in advance to reduce the scope of

the subsequent cleanup CL [1].

entry.title: Eliminate PrefetchDocumentManager::render_frame_host()
entry.content:
This CL eliminates the usage of PrefetchDocumentManager::render_frame_host().

Currently, PrefetchConainer's ctor receives and stores the information

of the referring RFH (when triggered from PrefetchDocumentManager), so

we can utilize that information instead. (Indeed, some other code have already do like this, so we can align to it)



It will also be helpful to reduce complexity of upcoming changes that

introduce the other prefetch manager, which will no longer be dependent

on RFH.



This CL doesn't intend to change any current behavior.



Bug: 40946257

Change-Id: I5b85b3002c1cbe5ed120ee83b689394be6df7774

entry.title: Revert "[FspCache] Introduce map of operation IDs to file handles"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ad3eddd55530124a6a8c5950c793ab2ab02eb893.



Reason for revert: The operation ID will no longer be used.



Original change's description:

> [FspCache] Introduce map of operation IDs to file handles

>

> Previously, the caller of a CloudFileSystem::OpenFile request would be

> returned the file handle created by the underlying FSP OpenFile request.

>

> Instead, the CloudFileSystem should assign a new operation ID upon a

> successful underlying FSP OpenFile request. This operation ID will be

> returned to the caller and will be used by the caller to communicate

> with the CloudFileSystem regarding the opened file.

>

> The CloudFileSystem will still use the file handle to communicate with

> the underlying FSP by mapping each incoming operation ID to the file

> handle created by the underlying FSP. This mapping will be deleted upon

> file close.

>

> The motivation for this change is so that in the future, a unique

> mapping can be made between disk backed operations (identified by a disk

> FD) and cloud backed FSP operations (identified by a file handle). The 2

> operations may return identifiers that clash and any requests for a

> clashing identifier would be difficult to disambiguate.

>

> Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCloudFileSystemTest*

> Bug: b/328670254

> Change-Id: I9884f90ebbbcc6b2e4d1aa2628a79560c98858eb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5354173

> Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

> Reviewed-by: Ben Reich

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271374}



Bug: b/328670254

Change-Id: I0c642bc41630a13bfbfd7b894b4e4628f1466c49

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366796

Reviewed-by: Ben Reich

Commit-Queue: Cassy Chun-Crogan

entry.title: Make sure R is in MSB in BGR_565
entry.content:
On android, AHARDWAREBUFFER_FORMAT_R5G6B5_UNORM has R in its MSB. On

linux desktop, the display hw more commonly supports DRM_FORMAT_RGB565

which has R in its MSB. Finally, skia's kRGB_565_SkColorType has R in

its MSB.



It is unclear whether R is in MSB or LSB for BufferFormat::BGR_565 and

SinglePlaneFormat::kBGR_565. Make sure R is consistently in MSB for

both.



Bug: b/329328021

Test: DRM_FORMAT_RGB565 over EXO

entry.title: Revert "[Invokers] Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'"
entry.content:
This reverts commit adedac451fc3c209790b3e6cff4aa32b88cc493b.



Reason for revert: Modified wpt fails on mac: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/26150/blamelist



Original change's description:

> [Invokers] Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'

>

> This change refactors the `HandleInvokeInternal` calls to use an enum

> class of known attribute values including a `kCustom` key which can determine if the invoke action meets the criteria for being

> a "custom" action - that is it includes a dash (see

> https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9841/commits/b40ba866cc21553f63d8f6244becbdbc38176310).

>

> This also updates the tests to reflect this; only actions with a `-`, or

> otherwise known actions, will dispatch an event. All other actions do

> not, and must be manually dispatched. This does not preclude web authors

> from manually dispatching said events.

>

> Bug: 40947660

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapi: relax libva version check for Lacros in dedede
entry.content:
There is a check in the VaapiWrapper class to make sure that the system

VA-API version is not older than the version with which Chrome is

built since libva is only guaranteed to be backward (and not forward)

compatible.



In the case of Lacros on Jasperlake devices (dedede), this check fails

and it falls back to software encoding. These devices run with an older

libva driver due to b/303841978. While that bug is fixed, this CL

hardcodes the minor VA-API version number Lacros was built with so the

check does not fail and Lacros does not fall back to software encoding

on Jasperlake devices.



Bug: b:328766776, b:300976144

Test: hw encoding works in Lacros on dedede

Change-Id: I16566cb5195bc5b90292c187caca42eaae5193c2

entry.title: Hook in-browser attribution reporting with FetchLater API
entry.content:
Per offline discussion, some potential fetchLater() API users are

looking to use the API with attribution reporting ability, i.e.

sending out fetchLater requests with `Attribution-Reporting-Eligible`

header, where the corresponding responses should also be recognized by

Chrome privacy sandbox.



This CL enables the Attribution Reporting in-browser handler [1] to

be used by fetchLater loader to process such requests.



[1]: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KUQcj_WcOAjxj89WYtmUEaFdiCAQ2H4ODLyqRTbNeFY/edit?tab=t.0



Bug: 1465781,1374121

entry.title: LinkPreview: Stop specifying floating window and capturing
entry.content:
This patch changes to override OnNativeBlur() to close the

preview tab, and also changes to use AuditWebInputEvent()

to hook up mouse events to trigger a tab promotion.



OnNativeBlur() is also called before the mouse down event

unfortunately. So, the closing tab is executed asynchronously

so that if a mouse down event follows synchronously, we

do the tab promotion before executing the asynchronous tab closure.



Change-Id: I642b5a03b7d1e7f164ba24af8491d3ad99aa49ca

Bug: b/305007647, b/41485769

entry.title: Rename the cr_components omnibox/ directories to searchbox/.
entry.content:
More precisely:

ui/webui/resources/cr_components/omnibox/

->

ui/webui/resources/cr_components/searchbox/

and

chrome/test/data/webui/cr_components/omnibox/

->

chrome/test/data/webui/cr_components/searchbox/



Lots of things will have to change to generalize the concept of

omnibox/realbox to a "searchbox" useful in new scenarios. Which will

have to happen over time as it doesn't make sense to stop and change the

naming everywhere first. But this directory stands out to as having a

particularly confusing name when trying to use a searchbox in a new

context.



This CL also makes some changes to realbox_test.ts. The tests in this file have been flaky for a while. The failures are almost entirely in the areMatchesShowing() check. A change (crrev.com/c/4070784) to try to force the UI to update synchronously in this method may have helped. But a more recent change (crrev.com/c/5354009) to add async waits seems to me to be trying to solve the same problem in a better way. So I've removed the synchronous update here. Anecdotally, this seems to have produced fewer flakes, though I may just be getting lucky. Additionally, this cleans up some leftover comments.



Bug: b:328293795, 328827188, 328650182

Change-Id: Iadbd5b6c68d6b6f3810ebeeecbaabe423f81b451

This reverts commit 93e606dbf24d087b2adea0e806a8f3da6b9da439.



Reason for revert: crbug.com/330241089



This has broken tests such as tast a11y.Smoke where chrome cannot be closed with the dialog in view.

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Remove running_task_ fallback
entry.content:
TaskAttributionTrackerImpl::RunningTask() returns the value from CPED if

present, and falls back to a cached `running_task_` if that value isn't

set. This, it turns out, was necessary for soft navigation heuristics to

work in cases where CPED is cleared in V8, e.g. at the end of a

microtask. But while this fixed some problems, it was not a complete

solution since CPED and RunningTask() could get out of sync (and

therefore propagation did not work as expected).



The underlying CPED issues were resolved in crrev.com/c/5316657:

1. CPED is cleared at the start of RunMicrotasks()

2. CPED is cleared at the end of each microtask

3. CPED is restored to its previous value at the end of RunMicrotasks()

4. All Microtask objects in v8 are CPED-aware (previously only native

promises were).



All of these together allow us to remove the fallback, which this CL

does. (Note: (4) was also necessary because some microtasks were not

CPED-aware, e.g. custom elements reactions). (4) also allows us to

remove the custom handling for `queueMicrotask`, which is no longer

necessary since v8's EnqueueMicrotask() API propagates CPED.



PERFETTO_TESTS=`autoninja -C out/Default perfetto_diff_tests && out/Default/bin/run_perfetto_diff_tests`

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Always propagate the parent task
entry.content:
This is a step towards changing task attribution to propagate use-case-

specific task state through microtasks and callbacks instead of

maintaining the complete task graph (tasks and their parent).



Previously, we capped the length of a task chain at 10, at which point

we started propagating the parent task instead of a new task with the

given parent. This CL effectively changes that limit to 1, always

propagating the parent task if given, and creating a new task to

propagate if a parent is not given.



This should have no functional impact on soft navigation tracking

since SoftNavigationHeuristics only needs to determine if a "root

task" (one without a parent) is the ancestor of the current task, which

will be true if and only if the root task was propagated to the

current task.



This new approach does, however, affect task attribution testing.

To keep the same robustness in testing, this CL does the following:

1. Makes scheduler.taskId mutable. When the value is set, the

current context is overwritten with the new id. This makes it

easier to test changing the context and minimizes the differences

in tests.

2. Removes scheduler.isAncestor(). Since the same task id is always

propagated (starting at some root, where parent isn't set), this

concept is no longer needed. Instead, we can compare a stored id

with scheduler.taskId directly.

3. Tests were modified to set an initial taskId promimse_tests and

where we expected differences (e.g. in what were sibling tasks).

Ancestry checks were changed to id comparison.



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hZ1FdFtHoPk7h9mwTPJSlF83T7YnTpmfa0CEQbPn8Ks/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 40942324

Change-Id: I789bd174f37fe50adae0b2034027ef59b6ca9b5d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277817

entry.title: find-in-page: Wait for rendering in browser tests
entry.content:
With BlinkSchedulerPrioritizeNavigationIPCs enabled,

FindRequestManagerTest.FindNewMatches sometimes flakes on tsan/msan

builds. It also flakes occasionally without that flags, but it happens

more often with the flag enabled. FindRequestManagerTest.Basic also

occasionally flakes with the flag enabled, but less frequently.



Looking at traces, in the FindNewMatches passing case, rendering

happens before the first find-in-page IPC. In the failing case, it

happens after. This affects whether or not SendActiveMatch is sent to

the browser, which depends on TextFinder::should_locate_active_rect_

(it's true if we rendered, false if not). The ordering change is more

likely to happen with the experiment enabled since navigation IPCs

might run before CC initialization.



Given the apprarent implicit dependency on rendering, this CL changes

the find-in-page browser tests to wait for a rAF after loading the

page, which fixes the issue locally on a tsan build.



Bug: 330147459

Change-Id: I72c113aef357bbaaf33ca6a9218a68dbfd8a063f

entry.title: pine: Handle destroying pine contents data in ash
entry.content:
In CL:5324954 we repurposed the existing notification removal code to

handle clearing pine contents data. However, the existing notification

removal code is hardcoded at several points, and doesn't cover all edge

cases. This is fine for the notification, as it doesn't really block

anything. With pine, these edge cases can look pretty jarring.



Reworks this logic to be handled on the ash side, whenever a app window

activates. Removes the previous logic so that nothing is masked by the

old logic. And add a missing name in the HUDDisplay that I noticed

while using it to debug.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Implement better result stability check.
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5366274 fixed Tab Resumption Module's the general lag issue

by letting "fast path" fetching "nothing" put the Mediator into a

"tentatively gone" state, under which "slow path" fetching "something"

can cause the module to show.



Previously, ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider may fire "something"

via "slow path" many times, until a 10s of inactivity is reached, after

which the provider is declared stable and the TRM no longer change

(except to disappear on permission changes). This allowed the TRM to

fetch the freshest results at initialization. However, this also makes

it hard to decide, from the Provider's perspective, when results becomes

stable -- this will be needed for upcoming effort to gather metrics.



This CL fixes the problem by revamping how the TRM reaches stability.

Details:

* TabResumptionDataProvider: Add |mIsStable| flag with write accessor.

* ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: Remove time-based stability

detection; simply use |mIsStable|.

* Mediator:

* Revamp state machine: Decompose it into a direct product of:

* mModuleStage in {INIT, TENTATIVE, STABLE}.

* mDoShow in {false, true}.

* Extract setPropertiesAndTriggerRender().

* Extract onSuggestionReceived() for loadModule(), and change state

transition mechanics:

* Use simple progression INIT -> TENTATIVE -> STABLE (terminal).

* Compute |nextDoShow| to update |mDoShow|.

* Handle all transition cases using the two stages.

* On TENTATIVE -> STABLE: Tell Provider to be stable.

* In STABLE: (Defensive) Do not update UI if non-empty suggestions

exist; but still hide module on empty suggestions.



Testing:

* Update ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProviderTest (1 test).

* TabResumptionModuleMediatorUnitTest:

* Update makeValidEntry() to allow some variety.

* testInitialSomethingUpdateSomething(): Add check to ensure stability

is enforced.



Bug: 329122611, 327300173, 1515325

listeners registered for each webview instance. This is problematic in

cases where apps dynamically add and remove a lot of webview. With this

change we would now have just one listener for a window.

entry.title: [Invokers] Only dispatch invoke for built-ins or actions containing '-'
entry.content:
This change refactors the `HandleInvokeInternal` calls to use an enum

class of known attribute values including a `kCustom` key which can determine if the invoke action meets the criteria for being

a "custom" action - that is it includes a dash (see

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9841/commits/b40ba866cc21553f63d8f6244becbdbc38176310).



This also updates the tests to reflect this; only actions with a `-`, or

otherwise known actions, will dispatch an event. All other actions do

not, and must be manually dispatched. This does not preclude web authors

from manually dispatching said events.

entry.title: PDF OCR: add a test case using a three-page PDF
entry.content:
A new three-page PDF example helps PDFOCRIntegrationTest exercises the

code for batching OCR requests and creating paragraphs in OCR results as

it contains two paragraphs in Pages 2 and 3, respectively.



This CL also includes a small fix to a bug, which doesn't generate a

generic container node that contains OCR results when nodes for PDF a11y

tree are not yet unserialized.



Note that "three-page.in" was used to create the same PDF but including

accessible text. "inaccessible-text-in-three-page.pdf" was then created

by printing the accessible version as image.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Bug: 327298772

Test: out/Debug/browser_tests --gtest_filter=*PDFOCRIntegrationTest.ThreePagePDF*

Change-Id: I2bfcf0e01ff83dfcd1f4956855de41f960db1252

entry.title: Postpone UMA native calls until native is initialized.
entry.content:
These two methods consistently crash search activity and these crashes

are slowly becoming user visible.



This change proposes that we defer the calls to UMA until after the

native libraries are initialized. Both methods are deferred, because

each `umaSessionEnd` requires the `umaSessionStart` to have already

been called.



Bug: 327023983, 330217742

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatelessVD: Limit max simultaneous instances
entry.content:
This CL limits the maximum number of simultaneous V4L2StatelessVD

instances, similar to ToT and the recent https://crrev.com/c/5368833.



Unit test is extended via a typed test [1], which runs for both

stateful and stateless, skipping the corresponding API when the

platform doesn't support it (drivers support one or the other but

never both). Tests were verified on strongbad (stateful) and

corsola (stateless).



Re the disappearance of FRIEND_TEST_ALL_PREFIXES and use of a static

GetMax...ForTesting(). FRIEND_TEST_ALL_PREFIXES, and its underlying

FRIEND_TEST() macro, don't get along with the complicated test name

generator in gtest-typed-test.h; I tried a couple of approaches,

including using the same name extension used in the macros in that

file, and they all looked atrocious. Having a ForTesting() class

method sounded like the least bad option.



[1] https://github.com/google/googletest/blob/main/googletest/include/gtest/gtest-typed-test.h



Bug: 278935312

Change-Id: I1727b90610132fe357cfc81a4d5f03eed8312262

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5365946

Reviewed-by: Nathan Hebert

Reviewed-by: Fritz Koenig

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1274581}

entry.title: Suppress calls to Native Libraries before Native is initialized.
entry.content:
This change addresses a particular SearchActivity scenario,

where we show MostVisitedTiles but Native libraries may not yet be

initialized. There is a peculiar race that occasionally results with

a crash.

entry.title: Set content window visibility based on compositor visibility
entry.content:
If native occlusion is not enabled, then compositor visibility

corresponds to whether the platform window is minimized or not. The

content window's visibility is set based on this minimized status. With

native occlusion on, the compositor visibility is mostly determined by

the native occlusion. However, if there are video capture locks, then

the compositor may be visible even if the native occlusion state is

hidden or occluded.



This CL adds some methods to CompositorObserver to let

DesktopWindowTreeHostPlatform observe the compositor visibility and set

the content window visibility based on that. It also removes the current

path for setting the content window visibility for both the native

occlusion enabled and disabled cases.

entry.title: pine: Fix the gap between the screenshot and icon row
entry.content:
- Fix the gap between the screenshot preview and the icon row by

wrapping them in another container with appropriate vertical

margins.

- The width of the screenshot should always be 344px. Same in

both landscape and portrait orientations.

- Partial adjustment on specs.
